decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and spells to create a powerful toolbox of options. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp up mana, while also using cards like Viscera Seer and Spellskite for protection. The deck includes a variety of creatures with abilities that interact with each other, such as Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit and Melira, Sylvok Outcast. Cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling allow for efficient tutoring and deployment of creatures, while Gavony Township provides a powerful boost to your team.

The deck focuses on utilizing Eldrazi creatures with powerful abilities and cast triggers to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. With a combination of creatures like Eldrazi Mimic, Drowner of Hope, and Thought-Knot Seer, along with disruption from cards like Path to Exile and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence. The key strategy is to efficiently cast Eldrazi creatures using lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to build a threatening board state and pressure the opponent's life total.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of early game creatures like Eldrazi Mimic and Eldrazi Skyspawner, as well as powerful mid-game threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Drowner of Hope and Eldrazi Displacer to control the board and maintain pressure. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the Eldrazi creatures, with a mix of lands that provide colorless mana and access to white and blue mana for removal and disruption spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play powerful Eldrazi creatures early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with their efficient and disruptive abilities. By utilizing cards like Matter Reshaper, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher, along with support from cards like Ancient Stirrings and Kozilek's Return, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With strong mana acceleration from cards like Talisman of Impulse and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can efficiently cast its high-cost Eldrazi creatures and control the battlefield.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate and play powerful Eldrazi creatures in order to overwhelm the opponent and deal a substantial amount of damage. This is achieved through a combination of high-impact creatures such as Oblivion Sower, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by utility cards like Lightning Bolt and Kozilek's Return. The deck also utilizes land searching and acceleration cards like Ancient Stirrings and Eye of Ugin to ensure consistent access to Eldrazi creatures. The overall strategy revolves around aggressive play, utilizing the strength of Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield and secure victory.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck focuses on applying pressure early with aggressive Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Path to Exile and Thought-Knot Seer's hand disruption ability. By utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and efficient mana acceleration, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards such as Eldrazi Mimic, Endless One, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Drowner of Hope and Eldrazi Displacer to control the field. The Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin provide mana acceleration for casting the deck's powerful creatures, while cards like Path to Exile and Dismember offer removal options. The goal of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain board control to secure victory.

This deck revolves around casting multiple spells in one turn to generate storm count and eventually win the game by casting a lethal Grapeshot or creating a massive army of goblin tokens with Empty the Warrens. Goblin Electromancer reduces the cost of spells, while Past in Flames allows you to recast spells from your graveyard. Gifts Ungiven helps to find key pieces of the combo, while cantrips like Serum Visions and Gitaxian Probe help dig through the deck. Rituals like Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose provide mana to fuel the combo.

The deck relies on a toolbox of creatures that work together to assemble a powerful combo. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the player can search for specific creatures at the right time to disrupt the opponent's strategy and create strong synergies. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces, such as Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Viscera Seer, to create an infinite life and/or damage loop. The deck also utilizes powerful lands like Gavony Township to further enhance the creatures on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on assembling a combination of creatures to create powerful synergies and infinite combos. By utilizing cards like Melira, Anafenza, and Viscera Seer, the deck can generate infinite life, damage, or both. Collected Company and Chord of Calling are used to find the necessary pieces quickly, while cards like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness provide resilience and value. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility and adaptability, making it a versatile and powerful deck in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Eldrazi Mimic, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on in the game. Supporting cards like Ancient Stirrings and Lightning Bolt help to provide additional consistency and removal options. The mana base is built around Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to facilitate casting the powerful Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle to outpace the opponent and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Drowner of Hope. By using cards like Path to Exile and Dismember, the deck aims to control the board while steadily building up a strong board presence with cards like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Mimic. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures by providing the necessary colorless mana sources to cast them reliably.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's plans with disruptive spells like Dismember and Path to Exile. By utilizing Eldrazi Mimic and other early drop creatures, it aims to apply pressure from the start and overwhelm the opponent with large, hard-to-deal-with threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck's mana base is built around maximizing the efficiency of Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to quickly ramp into its big threats. Overall, the deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing cards such as Eldrazi Mimic, Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Oblivion Sower to overwhelm the opponent. With efficient removal spells like Dismember and Spatial Contortion, as well as land search and ramp cards like Expedition Map and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game. The inclusion of high-impact cards like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, the Great Distortion further solidifies the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana to eventually cast a game-winning Scapeshift spell. By utilizing cards like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Bring to Light, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo finish with Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck also includes ramp spells like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder to accelerate the mana base and ensure the combo can be executed in a timely manner. Additionally, cards like Snapcaster Mage provide versatility and recursion to outvalue opponents in longer games.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, along with counterspells and removal spells like Supreme Verdict, Path to Exile, and Condemn. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Spreading Seas and Detention Sphere while also generating card advantage through Snapcaster Mage and Sphinx's Revelation. Additionally, the deck utilizes land destruction with cards like Tectonic Edge and Ghost Quarter to gain a strategic advantage. This deck focuses on maintaining control of the battlefield and outlasting the opponent.
